replies.body: Love the background.  Why do we only have special backgrounds for featured game modes?  Standard game modes should get the same (or better) treatment.  Love the typeface above the chat window, it matches Ms. Pudding's old Patch Preview.

I honestly wonder why the game doesn't load while we pick. 

Dawngate was almost seamless going from picks to the game. I assume it's just a coding issue in the launcher that they can't overcome.

Legacy code. The in-game client and the chat client are completely different pieces of software (the chat client was originally written in Adobe AIR). In order to start loading, the in-game client needs to start running, and it doesn't know how to start loading without a full roster of players.

If Riot were starting today, they'd probably have one program that was the in-game client AND the chat client would be one program, so they could do cool things like loading during champ select.

I would very willingly download and patch every patch just to have the game load during champion select.

It would be worth it.

Their code is garbage, Riot has the problem of being a big game that started as an Indie game.

The map visual upgrade was the best step forwards they've done in years, however many parts of how the game was made are too difficult to change without possibly causing severe problems.

If you see how often the game and client breaks, imagine if they tried doing significant changes to the background code structure instead of the minor changes to champions.

Whether Riot will do it or not, they need a team building the game in a new engine which they can transfer the client over to in the next 2~3 years.

It's possibly they're doing that already and their goal is to coincide the transfer of the NA servers to a central hub around the time of completion.
